page.title: 17INDUSTRY - WHISKY
page.content: Donna Watt Age 11 My dad is a mashman. He is responsible for the extraction of sugar from the grist, barley. First he mashes the grist with water into the mash tun, a big boiler. After leaving it for half an hour he drains off the sugar liquid which is called worts. Then he pumps it into the washbacks. After he drains off all the worts from the mash tun he pumps the mash which is now called draff out of the mash tun into a trailer to be taken away for cattle food. Then the process starts all over again.
